page.title: 07THE EFFECT OF WATER
page.content: The River{Wear}flowed through the Team Valley until the Ice Age glacial deposits diverted it to Sunderland.The River{Team}now flows there and is joined by streams from the ravines {(Denes)}of Gateshead. The growth of Gateshead caused these streams to be channelled into sewers or culverts. The roads which pass the Denes are prone to flooding and in 1965 the{Chow {Dene}flooded the newly opened Breckenbeds School.The River Team meandered through the valley until 1936 when the buildings of the {"Trading Estate"}canalised the river and drained the swamps. Even in 1985 storm drains are being dug on the Team Valley to remove Gateshead's excess water.
